title: The only Bentley SUV in America rolled through Boston on Thursday - News and reviews
text: The Bentayga is Bentley’s first ever SUV. It was unveiled in September at the 2015 Frankfurt Auto Show and has been making a limited tour around the world since. The only model currently in the U.S. was exhibited at the Boston Harbor Hotel on October 15 in an event put on by Herb Chambers. Kelly O’Brien/Boston.com One ultra-luxury car draws another, as a Rolls-Royce idles outside the Harbor Hotel before the Bentayga’s unveiling. Kelly O’Brien/Boston.com The Bentayga emerges for its first appearance in New England. Kelly O’Brien/Boston.com A crowd gathers get up close and personal with the 600 horsepower SUV. Kelly O’Brien/Boston.com Bentley says the Bentayga has a 0-60 time of 4.0 seconds and a top speed of 187 miles per hour, thanks to its uniquely shaped 12-cylinder engine. Kelly O’Brien/Boston.com Bentley is among those carmakers on the path to autonomous vehicles. The Bentayga includes 12 ultrasonic sensors, up to five cameras and multiple radar systems. Kelly O’Brien/Boston.com The sensors allow the car to dim its high beams when another vehicle approaches, to check your blind spot, and to warn you of objects you might hit while opening your door. Kelly O’Brien/Boston.com The Bentayga also has a computer controlled air suspension system that can adjust the height off the road on command or automatically depending on speed. Kelly O’Brien/Boston.com There are seven different options for wood veneer on the interior, and 15 interior hide colors. Kelly O’Brien/Boston.com The 8-inch touchscreen has haptic feedback, which makes it easier to use without taking your eyes off the road. There is also a 60GB hard drive for storing music or other media. Kelly O’Brien/Boston.com A specialized city version can recognize traffic signals and pop them up on a driver display. It also has pedestrian warning, park assist and “top view,” which uses four cameras to construct a birds-eye view of your car and its immediate surroundings. Kelly O’Brien/Boston.com There are four driving modes: Sport, Comfort, Custom and Bentley (a blend of Sport and Custom). A specialized off-road version adds four more driving modes suited for grass, gravel, mud or sand dunes. Kelly O’Brien/Boston.com In one option, the car comes with two tablets programmed with a special Bentley interface. They can connect to the car’s Bluetooth and its 4G WiFi system in order to control a number of vehicle functions. Kelly O’Brien/Boston.com The on-board audio system consists of 18 speakers and a 1,950-watt amplifier. Kelly O’Brien/Boston.com Wheel sizes come in 20-, 21- or 22-inch options, the last of which is the largest wheel ever made by Bentley. Kelly O’Brien/Boston.com There are 17 standard paint colors available. The demo vehicle is a specially made color called Bentayga Bronze. Kelly O’Brien/Boston.com Under the hood is a W12 engine that makes the Bentayga the fastest SUV in the world, according to Bentley. Kelly O’Brien/Boston.com Bentayga test cars were driven more than a million combined miles across five continents to make sure they performed in the most extreme conditions. Kelly O’Brien/Boston.com The W12 engine has a unique dual-injection system. Kelly O’Brien/Boston.com There are 58 craftsmen and women in the Bentley woodshop, and it takes 130 hours of work make the hand-crafted interior aspects on every Bentayga. Kelly O’Brien/Boston.com Luxury and fuel economy don’t mix, as the Bentayga gets just 16 miles per gallon. Kelly O’Brien/Boston.com Bentley is pricing the Bentayga at just over $229,000, according to USA Today. Kelly O’Brien/Boston.com By Kelly O'Brien Share 0 Tweet 0 Advertisement
